src:
Capturan a ex funcionarios de Empresa Portuaria Nacional Santo Tomás de Castilla

07 Nov 2019, 14:05

La Fiscalía contra la Corrupción desarrolla operativo con apoyo de la PNC en San Miguel Petapa y Livingston, en donde se capturó a ex directivos de la Empresa Portuaria Nacional Santo Tomás de Castilla (Empornac).
Se trata de 3 allanamientos de inspección, registro y secuestro de evidencias; y la captura de Romualdo Augusto Mejía López, ex interventor de Empornac; y Hugo René Vásquez Gómez, ex director financiero de la entidad.
Ambos son sindicados del delito de peculado.
En la investigación realizada por la Fiscalía se determinó que en la Empornac, durante 2003, se realizaron dos inversiones en el desaparecido Banco Promotor, S.A., por la cantidad de Q21 millones, monto que se perdió según las pesquisas.
En los medios de investigación, la Fiscalía destaca informes de la Contraloría General de Cuentas, fotocopias certificadas de expedientes administrativos y certificados de inversión, declaraciones testimoniales e informes de entidades públicas y privadas.



*Noticia en desarrollo

text:
They capture former officials of the National Port Company Santo Tomás de Castilla

07 Nov 2019, 14:05

The Prosecutor's Office against Corruption develops operations with support from the PNC in San Miguel Petapa and Livingston, where former executives of the National Port Company Santo Tomás de Castilla (Empornac) were captured.
It involves 3 inspections of inspection, registration and sequestration of evidence; and the capture of Romualdo Augusto Mejía López, former inspector of Empornac; and Hugo René Vásquez Gómez, former financial director of the entity.
Both are syndicated of the crime of peculation.
In the investigation carried out by the Prosecutor's Office, it was determined that in Empornac, during 2003, two investments were made in the disappeared Banco Promotor, S.A., for the amount of Q21 million, an amount that was lost according to the investigations.
In the investigation media, the Prosecutor's Office highlights reports from the Comptroller General of Accounts, certified photocopies of administrative records and investment certificates, testimonial statements and reports from public and private entities.



* News in development
